See also: fleisch

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Flaisch, flaisch, Fläisch, fläisch (Early New High German)

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German fleisch, vleisch, from Old High German fleisk, from Proto-Germanic *flaiską.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /flaɪ̯ʃ/
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Fleisch n (genitive Fleisches or Fleischs, no plural)

  1. flesh
  2. meat
  3. pulp (of fruit)
  4. (grilling) a slab of meat, meat which is not in the form of a sausage

Declension[edit]

Declension of Fleisch (uncountable)

1Now uncommon, see notes
